intro: Lythropsis, commonly known as the "false thornapple," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Scrophulariaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa. These plants are typically shrubs or subshrubs with hairy, often glandular leaves.
